column4: the first install on this was edgy then i did the update to feisty . . . is it safe to just di the upgrade to gutsy or should i start from scratch with that?
you might be better asking in #ubuntu+1 about upgrading to gutsy
well i mean in general for a new release is it better to just install again from scratch?
it depends what you've already got installed, whether you've got seperate partitions for /home etc, I do both depending on what i'm upgrading
yes i do have separate partitions
i'd probably do a fresh install rather than an upgrade then
the home directory woulndt interfere with anything would it?  i mean there would be like personal gnome settings maybe that wouldnt be compatible with the new gnome version?
not that i know of, whether you do an upgrade via the web, or a fresh install, the installer should pick up the settings from the original /home partition unless you tell it to format over it
is there a way to get like a file with the packages i have installed right now to remind me to install them?
that wont screw anything up with like pidgin having been gaim previously??
i don't know how things like that'll work i'm afraid
because it would be for upgrade
sorry what folder is the package list located under?
i've just tried it and its saved the my-packages in /home
like if i just wanted to create a text file of installed packages
the my-packages is a text file, you can open it with gedit or any other text editor
